title: How many bassists has Metallica had? - Quora

response.answer_text: Four. Five, technically. The first was Ron Mcgovney, who was with the band very shortly and soon left after former guitarist Dave Mustaine poured a full can of beer on his bass. This is also why Dave was kicked out and formed Megadeth. The second was Cliff Burton, who Lead Vocalist/Rhythm Guitarist James Hetfield and Drummer Lars Ulrich found when they heard "some serious shredding" at a bar and went inside to find Cliff Burton using wah and distortion pedals to play a bass solo, and they decided they had to bring him in. He is regarded as Metallica's best and most recognizable bass player, who is featured in songs like "Anesthesia" (a bass solo), "Orion" (a song with two bass solos) and "For Whom The Bell Tolls" (featuring a kickass bass intro). Cliff Burton was killed in a tour bus crash while on the Master of Puppets tour in 1986. Cliff was replaced by Jason Newsted of Flotsam and Jetsam. Newsted went through constant tormenting by the rest of the band , as they were still shaken from the loss of Cliff Burton. Jason Newsted performed on Metallica albums "...And Justice for All", "Metallica", "Load" and "ReLoad". In 2001 Newsted proposed for Metallica to take a year-long hiatus so he could focus on his side project Echobrain. The band refused, so he quit. Their new producer, Bob Rock, filled in on bass for their next album, "St. Anger". I don't really count this guy as a bassist, but technically he make five bass players. Robert Trujillo, their current bassist, joined in 2003.
